page.title: 08SMEATHARPE-THE RESIDENTS
page.content: The population of Smeatharpe is made up of residents of long-standing, their children and grand-children; senior citizens who have moved from other areas to retire here; and in- creasingly, young families from other parts of the country. There is no poor housing and at the same time there are no grand houses, which help towards breaking down social barriers. There is little unemployment in the village. Occupations are broken down thus: 7 people in the building industry; 8 in farming; 2 college lecturers; 2 civil servants; 1 comp- uter consultant; 2 small holders; 1 jeweller; 2 airport workers; 1 nanny; 1 nurseryman; 1 domestic cleaner; and 5 women in a variety of part-time occupations.
